Mexican Preparatory Committee Inaugurated
articles.content:
Mexican Preparatory Committee Inaugurated 
    Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Mexican preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the Workers' Party of Korea was inaugurated with due ceremony in Mexico City on July 21.
 Displayed at the inaugural ceremony were photos showing the great vitality of the Songun policy.    
 Ricardo Chavez Gutieres, chairman of the Central Committee of the Mexican Communist Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony.
 At the ceremony he said that the 60th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the Workers' Party of Korea are auspicious events common to the various Mexican political parties aspiring after socialism and the progressive people supporting the just cause of the Korean people and that they would grandly and significantly commemorate the holidays together with the Korean people.

Economic and Commercial Councilors' Corps Visits Victorious FLWM
articles.content:
Economic and Commercial Councilors' Corps Visits Victorious FLWM 
    Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors' corps here visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum on July 26 on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
 The guests looked round with keen interest the historic mementoes on display, being briefed on the fact that Kim Il Sung, the invincible and iron-willed commander and a great strategist, put forward the Juche-oriented military idea and unique outstanding strategic and tactical policies and aroused the whole party and army and all the people in the anti-U.S. war and the People's Army and the Korean people, united close around him, repelled the invasion of the U.S. imperialists and achieved a brilliant victory during the last Fatherland Liberation War.

Greetings to Peruvian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Peruvian President
    Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Alejandro Toledo Manrique, president of Peru, on Tuesday  on the occasion of the day of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would further develop, the message wished him a greater success in his work for welfare of the Peruvian people.
